response.text: Have you ever noticed the difference between coins with a face of a person on them and those without one?
I haven't really thought about it, to be honest.

Well, coins with a person's face on them usually represent a leader or ruler, and they serve as a symbol of authority and power. On the other hand, coins without a face on them usually have symbols or designs that represent the culture or values of the society that created them.
I see, that makes sense. I never thought about the symbolism behind different types of coins.
It's always good to be aware of the history and meaning behind the things we use every day, like money. It gives us a deeper understanding of the world around us.
